additionalTextInformation.text:
[The portrait of Luther] shows all the merits and mannerisms of the master with its meticulous execution and appears to be at least a distinguished work by a pupil if not by Cranach himself […] – the bust-length portrait of Katharina Luther […] is executed with less care and artistic merit. It appears to be a companion piece painted later.
[Steche 1890, 47]

The disparate yet related pair links the representations of ‘Junker Jörg’ from 1522 with the marriage portraits of Katharina. Her portrait draws on later versions from 1529 […].
[Exhib. Cat. Eisenach 2015, 104, No. 34]

pageContext.description: Martin Luther as Junker Jörg against a brown background, facing right; he is wearing a black gown and his left hand rests on the pommel of a sword.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 51 x 36 cm
[Exhib. Cat. Eisenach 2015, 104, No. 34]
pageContext.inscription:
- at the top edge: 
'DOCTOR MARTINVS LVTHER. PROPHETA. GERMANVS. ANNO. 1521. IN. PATHMO. AETATIS SUAE. 38. DEPINGEBATUR.' 
lower edge: 
'PESTIS. ERAM. VIVENS. MORTVS. ERO. MORS. TVA. PAPA.'
(propably later additions)
[Steche 1890, 47]

pageContext.provenance:
- from the estate of Canon Dr. Burscher, Leipzig 
- 1848 donated by C. Friedrich Aug. Roch to the church of 'Unser Lieber Frauen Auf Dem Berge'
- 1890 kept in the sacristy 
[Steche 1890, 47]
